These downstream markets comprise well over eighty percent of the demand for court reporting services,, these two markets are highly indicative of industry performance in a given year. In many industries, COVID closures meant that businesses held off on mergers and acquisition moves, which would slow demand from the business sector. On that same note, a slowdown in business ventures also harmed banking institutions, causing them to pull back on advisory roles on deals. current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Court Reporter Shortage in the US
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The United States is currently facing a critical shortage of court reporters, according to Law360, with the newest estimates totaling a shortage of 12,000 reporters. This issue stems primarily from two contributors: the high qualification standards required for prospective stenographers and a significant wave of retirements in the stenographer workforce. The shortage was brewing before the onset of the pandemic; however, COVID-19 has significantly exacerbated the situation.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Waning Demand for Bankruptcy Services Post-Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry saw a surge in demand during 2021 due to the economic recovery that came with diminishing small business loans. Local, state and national courts stayed busy by hosting online trials, keeping court reporters employed as a result. Despite this spark of hope, revenue generated by court reporters services is still expected to fall at an annualized CAGR of 2.0% to $4,166.5 million over the five years to 2024, with a 4.7% decrease during the year, when profit is expected to fall to 10.6%. During the next period, several economic trends are set to oppose each other. While corporate profit and business demand are set to grow, opposingly, divorce, crime and incarceration rates are expected to fall, running counter to the growth in the business sectors. As a result, revenue for court reporter services is anticipated to fall at an estimated CAGR of 4.6% to $3,300.6 million. Artificial intelligence capabilities are also expected to seep into the industry, creating an additional problem that operators must address. AI worries have grown, but experts reiterate that AI will be an addition to court reporters, honed to make a more effective service.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Unemployment as AI Technologies Become More Advanced
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There's little activity currently, but a handful of companies are actively developing software capable of performing tasks handled by a court reporter. This significant potential shift underscores the necessity for industry professionals to monitor these advancements as the industry evolves. AI is slowly bleeding into the industry. However, it is on the horizon; no technology or software is currently accurate and foolproof enough to replace court reporting services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Court Reporters are Expected to Experience Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: From a Range of Trends, Effecting Downstream Markets Corporate profit and per capita disposable income are expected to grow alongside the economy as it distances itself from the downward trends it experienced in the previous period. Economic uncertainty shook the industry at the end of the previous period, causing major declines across several downstream markets. As the US economy distances itself from these trends, expected growth in corporate profit is anticipated to strengthen demand from banking institutions and business firms. While growing per capita, disposable income is set to enhance demand from the household market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: US Crime Rates are Set to Continue Falling
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite recent claims that crime is rising in the US, the data tells a different story. Since the early 90's, violent crime and property-related crimes have been on the decline. Crime rates are expected to decline further through 2029, depressing demand from households and individuals, as well as the government market. While individual crime statistics may see upticks, the trend points toward further decreases in the overall crime rate.

key_trends: The United States is currently experiencing a significant shortage in court reporters, which has been further magnified by the pandemic. While digital court reporting has revolutionized the industry, there are still unique abilities offered by traditional court reporters that have yet to be matched by technology.
Court reporters must be well read on state, local and national court laws as the services they provide rely on knowing the state laws surrounding court room proceedings.
Acquiring state specific licensing and certifications can help operators distanced themselves from the competition.
The stenography industry is still dominated by traditional physical stenography services despite a scare in the 2010s about the reliability of audio recording systems.
The industry is slowly being impacted by artificial intelligence but is still expected to require stenographers' expertise.
Court reporters compete on a skill and quality based platform, making quality and accuracy the most important factors for operators.
Price competition becomes more prevalent during periods of slow economic growth when clients' legal expense budgets are decreased, and the price of services becomes more critical.

Nonemployers remain predominant in this industry and they retain stable profits. Although the overall profit figures for the period remain consistent, wages continue to show a slightly increasing trend.
Services in this industry come with high skill requirements and difficult certifications, this makes them high paying jobs relative to other costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses employ the services of court reporters for a multitude of reasons, consequently this downstream market makes up the largest segment. Court reporters provide an accurate, real-time transcript for events both electronically and physically for any form of litigation, whether it takes place in a US courtroom or in a conference room. Therefore, these services are invaluable to businesses.

Similar to business firms, banking and financial institutions require the same type of services. Banks and other financial institutions advise companies looking to sell the business, acquire other companies or divest specific business segments. This results in the need for professionals that can track the real-time progression of a deal. Due to this, financial institutions and banks command almost a quarter of total demand.

Government clients make up the last significant segment of the downstream markets. The government segment consists of local state, and national entities, all the way up to the highest court in the nation, the Supreme Court. Government court cases are high stakes and need the utmost accuracy, discretion and care. Only the most talented, seasoned professionals are chosen to provide court reporting for these.
The other segment in this market includes households, retailers, hospitals and other health care services, and not-for-profit. Services demanded from these markets vary.

products_and_services.product_description: Stenographic services refer to the physical act of sitting in a courtroom and recording the dialogue of a case, utilizing a steno machine and the shorthand language used by stenographers. Artificial intelligence caused worry as it came into discussion during the period. The 2010's had a similar scare when courtrooms all across the US decided to purchase top-of-the-line audio recording systems. These recording services were found to be unreliable and inaccurate, as a result thousands of retrials were required, leading courts back to traditional stenographers. Artificial intelligence is creeping up on the industry, but a stenographer's expertise is still expected to be fully needed in the industry despite the intrusion of AI.

Typing, document services and editing consist of typing services, document processing, editing, copying and reproduction, document finishing services and digital printing. Services in the typing, document and editing services industry take place after court is out of session. Court reporters edit and clean documents for court proceedings. These services follow the demand for court reporters, as more court cases will require increased document cleaning and copying.
Other services include distance conferencing services, telephone answering, and messaging services.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The largest downstream market for the Court Reporting Services industry is business firms. An increase in the number of business bankruptcies tends to lead to more businesses in bankruptcy court, in turn increasing the demand for court reporter services. Falling bankruptcies represents a potential threat to operators.
Since households are a downstream market for the Court Reporting Services industry, divorce rate fluctuations will affect demand for industry services.
Court reporters are legally required in all courtroom settings and must be present for every session; therefore, the incarceration rate reflects a portion of the demand for court reporting services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Price of Computers and Peripheral Equipment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Falling prices for faster and more accessible computers and corresponding peripherals has made the price of court reporting lower. Most court reporters use either a stenotype machine or a special laptop. However, the industry generally benefits from the falling prices for computers and peripheral equipment. Falling cost of computers and peripheral equipment presents a potential opportunity for operators.
